questions.question_text: Which method of password cracking takes the most time and effort?

discussion.content: a brute-force attack consists of an attacker submitting many passwords or passphrases with the hope of eventually guessing correctly.
A multipartite virus is a fast-moving virus that uses file infectors or boot infectors to attack the boot sector and executable files simultaneously.

Selected Answer: D
D. Multipartite Virus

In computing terminology, a macro virus is a virus that is written in a macro language: a programming language which is embedded inside a software application (e.g., word processors and spreadsheet applications

In computer security, a stealth virus is a computer virus that uses various mechanisms to avoid detection by antivirus software. Generally, stealth describes any approach to doing something while avoiding notice.

questions.question_text: Which of the following program infects the system boot sector and the executable files at the same time?

You are a Penetration Tester and are assigned to scan a server. You need to use a scanning technique wherein the TCP Header is split into many packets so that it becomes difficult to detect what the packets are meant for.
Which of the below scanning technique will you use?

discussion.content: IP fragmentation is an Internet Protocol (IP) process that breaks packets into smaller pieces (fragments), so that the resulting pieces can pass through a link with a smaller maximum transmission unit (MTU) than the original packet size. The fragments are reassembled by the receiving host

questions.question_text: You perform a scan of your company's network and discover that TCP port 123 is open. What services by default run on TCP port 123?

discussion.content: ntp port is 123, smtp is 25/465 dns is tcp/udp 54 telnet 23/22

The answer is B.
A. `c:\gpedit` is Group Policy Editor
B. `c:\compmgmt.msc` is the Computer Management console, which includes many management tools such as Device Manager, Disk Management, Local Users and Groups, Services, and more.
C. `c:\ncpa.cpl` is the Network Connections control panel, which allows users to configure network connections, Remote Desktop, and VPN connections.
D. `c:\services.msc` is the Services control panel, which allows users to view and manage various services in the system, such as Windows Update, application services, operating system services, and more.

Selected Answer: B
https://www.itechtics.com/compmgmt-msc/

I am going with B. 

Microsoft® Windows® Operating System seems to relate to ncpa.cp

There are many ways to open programs and one way is calling the application by the name which is executed to open it. Here is a great resource for identifying ways of using Computer Management https://www.top-password.com/blog/8-ways-to-open-computer-management-in-windows-10/

questions.question_text:
You are logged in as a local admin on a Windows 7 system and you need to launch the Computer Management Console from command line.
Which command would you use?
